review: It was 2 p.m. on a Sunday afternoon and there was a 15 minute wait.  Seriously?  We have to wait 15 minutes at 2 p.m. to eat lunch?  Unbelievable.  We had a gift card and the kids really, really wanted to eat here so we waited.  Usually, it is my general rule not to wait to give my money to anyone.  Just my thing.  We get seated by an overly enthusiastic server named Carollyn.  She is uber friendly and was pretty quick at taking our drink orders and food order but took a little long getting us bread.  I was starving so I really noticed that it took a long ass time.  It didn't really make any sense either.  It wasn't like it was freshly baked or even served warm but whatever.  Our food arrives shortly after the bread.  My daughter and I split the Pepperoni, Mushroom, Sausage Pizza, the hubby got the Habinero Carnitas Pizza and my son got the fetuccine alfredo from the kid's menu.  Everything was spot on what we expected from CPK.  On a side note, I went to the restroom and there was shit on the toliet seat.  Never a good thing to see.  They really should check up on the cleanliness of their restrooms.  Minus 1 star for that.

We were in Santa Cruz for the day and ran into this small whole in the wall with yummy looking cupcakes, so we decided to check it out. I had a delicious orange marmalade cupcake. It was moist and rich, but not overpowering. They just opened up so they need help passing the word around. Check them out.

Okay Yes, I admit it.. I go to CPK.. Who doesn't? It's conveniently located and a great quick place to grab a reasonably priced lunch.  I like a few of their salads-- in fact one in particular, I get on a regular basis, the Asparagus & Arugula Salad.. It's delicious!  They have lots of vegetarian options and I absolutely love their mushroom pizza.. ( when I'm in the pizza mode...) it's delicious with Shitakes, and maitakes, and portobellos and all that good stuff. We always order the honey oat grain thin crust verses the standard and I think it's supposed to be healthier.. not too sure about that, but it's good. Anyway I've always had great service and fairly fast food for a great price at this CPK. You can't go wrong here! ;-)

My favorite place to get a salad! I am still looking for a place that makes a better or as good salad. I have yet to have a bad meal here. If you get something you don't like they replace it without a hassle because of their "Menu Adventure Guarantee" or whatever they call it. Great wine list for a chain too. Another perk is the curbside pick up so I can get it to go without having to bare the cold nights or the mall.
I liked the service. We had a server in training as well as the regular server. Food was ok. I wish they would bring back some of the soups and salads I had years ago. Food is getting pricey though.
an all time favorite of ours for years.  great place to take the kids.  in the hillsdale mall.

The waits have gotten shorter since Cheesecake factory moved into town.  Today, we only had to wait 10 minutes.  The food is consistently decent and it is a very kid friendly place - huge variety of items to choose from on the kids menu and all the options are a big hit with the kids - they love the pepperoni pizza and the mac and cheese.   We usually run into people we know, but not tonight  I love the adventure guarantee which lets you try something new, but if you don't love it, they will give you your usual.  My go-to is the grilled vegetable sandwich, which is dee-lish.  i save the other half of the sandwich for lunch at work the next day.  Other folks got tuscan hummus, lettuce wraps, linguini clams and the roasted garlic pizza. There were no complaints!

Gotta give this place some love for their "Thai chicken Pizza".Not really a huge fan of pizza, but their "Thai chicken Pizza" brings all the unique california flavors that I just can not turn down.Its like eating Pad thai, thin honey wheat crust all in one bite. This place was the first place I ate at after moving here from the East coast and this place represents all the unique flavors California has to offer. It may be a chain, but its not your average pizza joint. Definitely a fan!

This place is so yummy. I got the BBQ chicken salad - should have got a half - it was huge and delicious. Fresh veggies and chicken with a great tasting dressing. My friend got a Chipolte chicken pizza - that was excellent. The service was prompt, friendly and the staff knowledgeable. We also got the asian dumpling appetizers and they were something I'd order over and over. Meal came quick, reasonable price and overall a great experience. I am going back to try more selections from the fast menu.
I thought the food was excellent, totally exceeded my expectations.  (try their kungpao pasta)

I guess I should've gotten a salad, but it is a pizza place after all.  I got the White Pizza with bacon, the boyfriend ordered The Works, both thin crust.  Not good.  The toppings were scarce and the cheese non-existent.   I almost never send food back and I didn't know about the Menu Guarantee that another review mentioned, if I'd known I might have complained.  We probably won't go back, Rainbow Pizza, North Beach or Zorbas are much much better for the $.

Food is very good like four cheese tortellini taste well but generic grocery store taste. Fried macaroni = would not reccomend it is literally fried into pieces that look like chicken nuggets and crisp takes away from flavor which is not worth it. Pizza was tasting very yum. Overall well experience but a bit too pricey and very full, and a lil noisy.

The food is alright but the smell in the restaurant just wasn't the freshest, it has this heavy grease smells in the air that came from the kitchen. I think the restaurant is in desperate needs for a serious refreshment.

First they get rid of the Rosemary Chicken Potato Pizza and now the Sundried Tomato and Broccoli Fusilli?!  My two favorite menu items are gone!! :(   Aside from that, this location is always pretty busy since it's located inside the Hillsdale Shopping Center.  If there are seats open, I like sitting at the bar if there's just two of us.  It's fun to see the pizzas baking and everything else going on in the kitchen.  They give you complementary bread and butter but I always ask for fresh out of the oven pita bread (and butter) instead for only a $1 charge.

We enjoy the food when it's done right- and mostly it really IS done right :) The waitlist system is a mess, and the staff we've encountered handling the waitlist have been beyond disorganized. Example: We've repeatedly had our names skipped, after waiting LONGER than the stated wait time. So finally, I feel compelled to write a review. * Here's an idea: Hand out alerting monitors during long wait times so guests can browse nearby shops, instead of sitting around & hovering within earshot inside the echoing mall atrium. This isn't rocket science, this isn't even a new technology, and it's been used in restaurants for at least a decade by now. * Here's a simpler idea: Have staff neatly cross-out who's been seated and where they've been seated. Why? Because the CPK staff have said to me: "Oh! Some one took your table." which is ridiculous, b/c 1) the statement addresses the issue of who I should blame, instead of how the CPK staff plan to fix the mistake. * Here's the simplest idea of all: Have the SAME staff person manning & calling out the waitlist names, in order to minimize confusion. Good service and smart management matters. So we'll send our dollars elsewhere. Thank goodness there's plenty of good eating in San Mateo.

I am a big fan of CPK! Not a big fan of pizzas. I know you may be thinking, why would you go to a pizza kitchen if you don't like pizza? Maybe because I love their pastas and salads!! I recommend asking the waiter for recommendations, because dishes at the bottom of the list are usually not their specialties. Go with the original dishes!

This place has been alright the couple times I've been here.  Pizza is okay, not the worst I've had. However, the most recent time I went, our waitress was so rude.  She walked up to our table and said, "K, what do you want?" and while we were still trying to decide, she picked at her finger nails like she was bored out of her mind.  The only other time I saw her was when she dropped off our drinks, (which she never came to check on).  I didn't see her for the delivery of the pizza, no check-ups on what we might need, and no delivery of the check.  It's not like she was on break or something, because I saw her at her other tables. Whatever, she got a $0.50 tip anyway.  But still, rude service from their wait staff.
California pizza was ok but the the service sucked, it took them an hour to give me my food. AND it was a slow day too.

I had the margharita pizza here, and my boyfriend got some kind of pasta dish that was so unmemorable that I can't remember what it was (!) Both dishes were very blah. Had I known this, I would have seriously chosen RoundTable Pizza over this. Not only would I have saved a few bucks, I would have also had good take home food for the next 2 days.  Maybe we just ordered the 2 worst dishes on the menu, but I really just don't get this place.

The service here is really going down hill.  We just had a waiter who screwed up another table's order and forgot to enter our order.  This is the worst experience we've had so far.  Never seem to be able to catch the waiter and had to help ourselves for things we need. Thumb down.
yea this is a ok place to eat. my daughter ordered alfredo pasta bubt where was the sauce it was verrrrry light on sauce :-(  maybe ill come back

The Background: Chain restaurant nestled in the mall right by Starbucks and nordstorm in Hillsdale Mall. Would describe it as "fancier than pizza hut pizza" with salads, pastas.  The details: Ordered takeout at this location and when I came on a Sunday Night it was pretty crowded for both take out and dine in. Food was ready on time as promised...I was able to pick everything up in about 5-10 minutes. Definitely recommend the habinero carnitas pizza - think carnitas, cilantro pesto, cheese and the SPICIEST SALSA EVER. It packs and punch! ($14.11 with tax, which is kind of pricey I mean you can buy pizza hut and feel just as deliciously good for less in my opinion. ) My experience was positive, but my friend who ordered take out too was missing bread, utensils, salad dressing. So that was unfortunate, hopefully this isn't the typical case and a fluke caused by a flustered server.  The verdict: Takeout is super easy at this location, in and out and you can either call in or order online.  CPK is a great pizza choice for when you really don't know what to eat and want something safe and are willing to fork over a little extra for dinner.

I like CPK, I think that their food is good! I am a real fan of their customer service specially their day supervisor! I feel bad cause I forget his name I think it's Mike, but we went there for veteran's day and he was the supervisor on shift. He was very helpful and super nice! Great service!

Stopped in for a little lunch with my girl. I had the Waldorf salad no apples, excellent, my girl had a mushroom pizza very good. We sat at the end of the bar and were waited on by the lovely Amanda. While there, there was a man and woman ordering at the registrar, this took about 25 minutes. I only noticed because this took a long time to order food to go. After overhearing slightly something about a avocado the classy woman turned to me and said "you want to join our conversation or do you just want to stay with you girl friend". ..homophobes. Yes we are lesbian. So, this is where I'm going, the staff was outstanding, immediately Michael (the poor cashier who had to listen to the couples crap) came over and apologized. I told him, know worries Fausto and Amanda were apologizing as well. They comped us a dessert. Just very professional and on target. We will be returning. Thank you,

ZERO STARS Just about the worst ever. Stopped by for lunch after golf. First off the front door hostess was on the phone and didn't even look up to acknowledge us.  Sat down and orders drinks. When we asked for a vodka the waiter looked at the wine list and said they didn't have any...WOW Ordered a vodka on the rocks with an olive and onion, drink showed up with a lime. Everything went downhill from here. After awhile the same clueless waiter came by and asked if we wanted anything.....what about the drink order?  We then tried to order food. Wanted a club sandwich on wheat bread, he said the didn't have that kind of bread!   WHAT! We then decided on a pizza. Ordered a large to share with green peppers, he said all they had were yellow and red peppers. When the pizza showed up it had green peppers. What's up with this place? Be advised if you go to this place you're in for a real BAD experience.

I visited CPK with my girlfriend. I ordered a margherita which I found very tasty but rather chevy. The dough was somewhat compact so after I ate half of the pizza my jaw was really starting to get tired (I don't wear a denture, trust me). For dessert I ordered a tiramisù which I found very tasty as well. The layers of lady fingers with rhum were just like they make them in Italy. The only problem was the thickness of the top layer which abundant in mascarpone (6-8mm ... 2mm are more than enough) but lacked a good dose of powdered cocoa (cocoa was barely sprinkled). The tiramisù was good but it was rather heavy. A portion easily feeds two people. The place is somewhat loud and the seats in the booths are way too low, so low my elbows were at the same height of my shoulders ... not very comfortable. Manny, our server, was excellent and humorous.
My sister and I sat at the bar yesterday.  Shared the Moroccan salad and the artichoke and spinach pizza.  Amanda, the bartender was super awesome.  Very friendly, and helpful.
Want crappy service and eat with dirty and dusty plates? This place is for you

My husband and I dine out quite often.  We go to CPK all the time.  We have never had a bad experience.  The food is good, nothing fancy but you can always depend on the chef to create dependable, good dishes.  The last time we were there, I ordered a salad that was not what I expected.  Our waiter took it back without questions asked.  Immediately right after I returned the dish, the manager, Serafina, came to our table to see if she could bring a replacement.  That's what I call good customer service!  They do care about their customers.  They have been at this location for many years and I hope they will stay for many more years to come.

The Chicken tequila pasta is my fav and that's what i always order here. I m giving a 4-star due to the food, but the service is bad, I mean i understand they get busy but the gentleman we had was horrible. Didn't offer bread, messed up the order, didn't re-fill the drinks, so i actually asked another waiter instead of the one we had.  But food is always amazzzzzzing :-)

I had not been here since literally 1997, mostly because I thought the food was just okay and way overpriced. I decided I would give the place a try and man has their menu expanded. The roasted vegetable salad was delicious and the half size is more than enough. They have a couple of small plate options that were low cost and high taste. I enjoyed my experience.

It has been years since I dined here and have enjoyed the tortilla spring rolls, garlic cream feticini with chicken, and other dishes; fast forward to yesterday and aside from the prices going up, nothing has changed.  Our server, Anthony, was wonderful, leaving nothing to chance and checking back frequently, but not too much so.  the jerk chicken pizza is wonderful; a thin crust with tender spiced chicken in jerk spices, a spicy Caribbean bbq sauce, onions, and peppers.  The bread is fresh and my niece loved her chicken nugits and my mother and brother's girlfriend shared the tequila chicken feticini and loved it.  For dessert, we shared the caramel pudding with caramel, sea salt, and a light chocolate cake; very light yet sinful.  I loved the Crisp Apple Cider as it was not sweet but not much of a beer flavor either.  I love the casual yet trendy atmosphere with both traditional and creative dishes.  So, for wonderful pizza and other fare at a reasonable prices in a casual trendy atmosphere, California Pizza Kitchen cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.

CPK is CPK.  The pizza menu is creative, if you want a pepperoni pizza, its on the menu, but many of the CPK exclusives are quite delicious and not available at most pizzerias.   The menu was recently (sometime in the last 2 months) revamped.  Many of the tried and true favorites are still there.  I was not familiar enough with the old menu to know what all changed.   I enjoyed the new red wine flight.  A white wine version is also on the menu. Service is always decent at this CPK.  I have never been disappointed by the service, nor have I been wowed either. The Belgian Chocolate Soufflé Cake is amazing.

Is this the best pizza on Earth? No. But it's consistent. It has some pretty decent pizza for our money. I've gone to CPKs for far longer than I want to admit but this one in the mall we've been going to for about 10 years. It can feed my hubs and I, my vegetarian Mom and my picky eater son.     Tonight, though, I have to give them major shout out. We had dinner there. It was around 7pm and the place was jumping. A lot of families, a lot of people, a lot of noise. We kind of had to shout out our order to our waiter. He brought us our drinks, apologized because he had ice in my Mom's drink (we had ordered it without) so he took it back and got her a drink without ice. Our hummus arrived, tasty, the wheat pitas were hot to slather on the hummus.     Then our mains arrived. My hubs had the half Caesar salad with chicken and I had the roasted veggie salad half. Both are enormous, enough to feed two people rather easily. Our son had the mac and cheese which he loves. After a couple of minutes the California club pizza arrived ... except my Mom had ordered the California veggie pizza (which used to be the eggplant pizza). The waiter apologized profusely and took it back. He told us it would take about ten minutes to make the new pizza. After about a minute, another wait staff came by and asked if we wanted the pizza on honey whole wheat which we said yes.     My Mom and I ate my roasted veggie salad (which was super tasty) and about five minutes into our wait, the manager walked over to apologize profusely about the mix up. We told him it wasn't a problem and that we were fine. A couple of minutes later, the waiter returned to apologize again and tell us the pizza would be done within a few minutes. Sure enough, about five minutes later the pizza arrived.     The manager returned again to let us know that our pizza would be comp'ed for the mix up and made sure our bill reflected it. He apologized again to us and yet again as we left.     I have to admit, this was really refreshing. Independent restaurants have a hard enough time admitting messing up but to have a chain restaurant manager do it was just shocking. It made us fans of the CPK even more.

We used to be regulars here but the changes made in the past year leave much to be desired.  The menu has cut down A LOT and some of my favorite pizzas are no longer available.  The only reason why we still eat here from time to time is because our kids love it.  The children's menu and prices can't be beat.

the service was 1 star. i would give zero if it were an option.  the food was 3 stars the ambiance was 3 stars.  i would say it would be a good place to take your kids, but the wait staff was so slow that if you have impatient young children, go elsewhere.  cheescake factory is on the other side of the mall. the service is fast and the food is better.  cpk has always been one of my favorite places to eat- but the experience i had here was so awful, i may never go back.

Came here as a "spur of the moment" kinda deal. We ordered the wild mushroom pizza w/ chicken (which was absolutely no good). It was tasteless, bland, and they didn't put enough sauce. Also ordered the artichoke dip which was da bomb! They served it with tortilla chips and it was mucho delicious.  Service was nice.

Ordered "The Works" pizza today.  It was okay, but I'm not sure if I'm imagining things but the last few times I went to a CPK (both here and Palo Alto-Stanford Shopping Center), I felt the portions were very "measured i.e. skimpier" than before. I'm hoping CPK can get a better rating from me in the future.  I'd not big on "mediocre pizza, salads, etc", but am willing to come in again.  In this economy, and with our sales tax rate going up, it's nice if a restaurant gives you a little more than you expected.   On the up side, the staff is always friendly, smiling and courteous.

I've been to this location a couple times before and it's been pretty consistent.  Once again, the service was pretty good and there was nothing to complain about as far as the food went.  It's also a great place for large parties and very kid friendly. We started out with two orders of spinach artichoke dip.  It came out fast and the seven of us had no problems polishing them off pretty quickly.  If you are going to visit CPK the dip is the way to go.   The rest of the food was decent, although nothing to really write home about.  There was spaghetti, Garlic Cream Fettuccine with chicken, pizza, salads and a few other things.  I really enjoyed the frozen strawberry lemonade, it was like a lemonade slushy.  I'll definitely be getting one of those next time I'm there! Our waiter was very friendly.  Although, there was one order that wasn't right.  They apologized profusely and still had the right dish out before he finished his salad. Overall it's a little on the pricey side for what you are getting, but they have something for everyone and the food doesn't suck.

Thank you CPK and Cecilia! Just want to say that my hat goes off to CPK for their involvement in sponsoring a youth baseball team this year! It made my nephew so happy, which made the rest of my family happy! I just wanted to thank Cecilia for all her help. If it wasn't for her, it would have been just an ordinary experience. She gave it that little extra!  Extra- ordinary!

It's a chain so nothing too much to say about the food- we've gone before and enjoyed and will go again (love the thai chicken pizza and the pear & gorgonzola pizza) which is why I gave it 4 stars.  Our last experience is why I'm writing the review- I wish I could remember our servers name because I would list it here to avoid due to his poor service. He was very short with us and acted like he wanted to rush us. He took our order and we didn't see him for a while but we noticed other tables getting bread and a dip. We asked another server if that was complimentary and he said yes, and offered to bring us some. Why didn't our server offer? No idea- I guess he didn't want the extra work. The wait was a little long and with three hungry people, we asked him for more bread. (and assumed he would see that we had finished the dip as well and would bring more of that as well but no, he takes the plate and dip dish, but just brings back 3 pieces of bread and did not refill the dip... what a joke. got the food and it was great- but had to keep flagging him down for soda refills rather than him coming to check in on us like normal service. They also had a promotion going on where you get a coupon to bring back that the manager has to open to see what kind of discount or winnings you get. Didn't get that either, had to ask another server again. As I'm writing this I'm kicking myself for leaving him a tip- less than what I normally give but he really didn't deserve one. If I remember his name I will post it so maybe he'll change his ways.

Friend and I were craving for some pizza and we didn't want to go back into the city and find parking for an hour (we were already at Tanforan) - everyone knows parking in San Francisco requires, especially when it is dinner time and you are extremely hungry! We decided on CPK, plus I wanted the avocado egg roll appetizer, I find that CPK's avocado egg roll is much tastier than BJ's (and of course we ordered it, yum). We each ordered a pizza and we ended up having to take most of it home, not because it was bad but we were stuffed. I would say the food isn't bad for achain restaurant and the service is great (the waitress was nice and responsive) and I would come back again..but it isn't the best pizza out there but it is good enough to fill your tummy.

This Restaurant has one of the best pizzas in the area! we had a pizza with avocado, arugula and spinach, it was mmmmmmmmmmm Delicious!  Great service!  excellent customer care!  very nice and clean.  I will go back for sure!  Great job!
Been coming here for years.  Big fan of the curbside pickup option. just call in your order and drive to the parking spots across the street! absolutely love this service!

Suspending disbelief is the key ingredient in enjoying an excellent meal here. Forget for a moment that you are at the edge of a busy shopping mall, children with limited manners, parents constantly checking their iDevices and the busyness with which the staff runs around delivering drinks and food around the place. sitting at the horseshoe bar focuses your attention on the oven and guys making the pizza - a great source of inspiration if you aren't sure what to order. Or... you could go on a random weeknight when it is much more quiet, sedate and decibels of an enjoyable level. Sit at the horseshoe bar and focus on the nice brick oven. This was a weeknight date spot for me and the girl for quite a while. 2 glasses of wine and soup or salad to start, then we could relax and decide what to get on on the main course, pizza. No hurry, no whining kids, no rushing servers waiting on multiple tables with multiple requests. Just calm, yummy scents and the heat from the brick oven. The BBQ chicken is the old standby, but they have lots of other standards (pepperoni and cheese) and more exotic mix and  match pizzas with seasonal greens, veggies and so on. If you do go on the weekend, specifically let the host(ess) know that you prefer bar seating - no kids allowed at the bar and you get in and seated quicker. Then you can head over to Williams Sonoma, with a full belly and the inspiration to spend $20 on a pizza cutter.

Came and ordered a half Cesar salad with shrimp and a lemonade (I don't know why, but I love CPK lemonade!). The waiter brought me a pink drink (I assume strawberry lemonade) and I told him I asked for regular lemonade to which he responded "Do you want to try it anyways?" which I thought was kind of rude and said no.... But other than that, the salad was great and I think he felt bad because he was really great with our bread and water after that.
Love this place go here all the time! Bread and pizza are amazing. Brownie sundae is to die for! Only downside is the horrible service.
Kids love it and I love it, service sometimes slow but lately service has been fantastic!  They are always accomadating big or small parties.

CPK has always just been the "no where to eat at the mall so let's go there" type of restaurant for me and my friends, so I never had high expectations even though they're generally pretty good. I was pretty blown away by the service here though. I came on the day after Christmas so it was pretty packed as well. The hostess at the front was really nice and was always smiling even though there were so many people waiting outside asking her how much longer they needed to wait. Our server was a nice lady who gave us refills multiple times. There was this gentleman - and he wasn't even our server that looked busy going in and coming out of the kitchen waiting tables - he was very nice and asked us if we wanted more bread every time he passed by. He also proactively told us that he was willing to get us more lettuce (for the lettuce wrap appetizers) if we needed more. I was quite amazed by the service here.

Used Hillsdale Mall CPK twice this week for take out sandwiches and soup. I enjoyed the sandwich the first time so much that I went there second time a few days later. Food looked great and tested even greater. Quality was awesome.  It was super easy to place order online and the food was ready when I got there at a stated time. The personnel at the pickup desk was friendly and handed over me the food with a smile. I would certainly use them again.

I don't have anything riveting to say except, the grilled veggie salad was acceptable and the pizza was OK.  I had to order a pizza sans the cheese as I am vegan.  Places like these would benefit in revamping their menu to make room for vegan and even gluten free options.

I really try my best to avoid restaurant chains, but this one is too good to resist. The salads are tasty and can be as healthy or as un-healthy as you desire. The thin crust pizza has a crispy crust and won't over-fill you. And the key lime pie, creamy and tart with a firm and crunchy graham cracker crust, is great. Consistent as well, we have been there about 10 times (Hillsdale mall).

I had a late lunch at the CPK in Palo Alto (the wild mushroom pizza is to die for!), and decided to bring home pizzas for my kids (they LOVE the regular cheese pizzas) for dinner. Upon arriving in San Mateo, much to my dismay, I discovered that I had been given the wrong kind of pizza (something with mozzarella and basil) and my finicky children wouldn't even try it. I called the Hillsdale store and explained my dilemma to the manager Fausto and asked him if he would be willing to exchange the offending pies for the desired ones. Even though it was not his store that caused the problem and he had no obligation to do so, he graciously agreed to fix the mistake. His actions did more than just save me the gas and time to drive back to Stanford (probably 45 min round trip) with cranky hungry kids in tow, they demonstrated in a tangible way that CPK really cares about customer service and satisfaction. Because of this manager's kindness, CPK has a loyal customer for life!

One of my boyfriend and I's favorite places to eat. Service is always friendly. Our favorite dishes are: BBQ Chicken Chop Salad Hawaiian Pizza Spinach and Artichoke Dip Avocado Rolls We eat here very often and are part of their Pizza Dough Reward program which is great.
This is a great California Pizza Kitchen. The Thai Crunch Salad is simply delicious. Be sure to eat here sometime while you're shopping at HSC.

I went with my family for lunch and it was amazing. The food is great and the service is good too. It's a very convenient location, located at the Hillsdale shopping center and is a perfect place to eat after shopping.
I ordered the dakota soup, was good as well as the Hawaiian pizza. All good, quick service, friendly staff :-)

Ok I would have gave 5 stars if i didn't have a bad experience last night when my daughter called in a order so we can make a movie on time, but when i got there she said there was no order called in, so the call center made a mistake with the order and when i called back she was rude and said well i dont have anything under you name so call the restaurant manager i cant help you.  well that would have made me give 1 star but the restaurant made the order real quick and that made me feel better about coming back.

Amazing. Hawaiian and The Works are what my boyfriend and I ordered last night. So good! I always underestimate how filling pizza can be. We left with two slices of each to take home. Staff is always smiling and helpful to suggest their favorite dishes. Be sure to eat here if you're ever searching for food at Hillsdale!

I'm not going to lie, I love CPK! Oddly enough, I don't care much for their pizzas but I always find myself coming back for their pasta and appetizers.  Food: - Chicken Tequila Fettuccine: My favorite pasta dish ever!! It's very unique and I've never had a fettuccine that was bursting with so much flavor. It doesn't taste like tequila per se, but there is a nice hint of lime and peppers within the sauce, and it has the perfect amount of creaminess. It comes with ample chicken and bell peppers and usually I can't even finish all of the meat. The noodles are always just the right texture and are never overcooked or under cooked. This is definitely a major plus for me, because a lot of restaurants, especially chain restaurants, do not cook the noodles for just the right amount of time. - Avocado egg rolls: These are crispy, sweet and salty, and who knew avocados would go so well within an egg roll. This is an appetizer that I usually never pass up whenever I come to CPK.  Service: I've never had an issue with the service or the wait. Most I've waited is about 15 minutes, and I've had attentive service each time. The waiters are always around to refill your water or ask if you need anything else, and for a busy restaurant they've always provided great service. CPK is definitely reliable for a cheap but satisfying dinner and the service has yet to disappoint.
3rd time coming here. Son order a sandwich found a big long black hair in it!!!! Not coming back!!!! Again!!'
The menu is getting smaller,  but the patronage is strong.  They must be doing something right.

We just went to CPK this morning and we go there every weekend!  My favorite dishes are cheese pizza and pasta.  When I eat there, my Dad always order me a lime juice because it's delicious!  Also, the super nice guy Brian behind the counter always offer his best possible services whenever we're there eating & watching ball games on TV!  Thanks Brian ... my friend!                                                   Thank You,

We came here tonight and I've got to say, right off the bat - service is very lacking!  I know, it's a chain and what do you expect, but this was bad.  We walked in and a few people working there just looked at us - no welcome or hello or we'll be right with you.  A woman walked up to the register but didn't acknowledge us, so we asked if we should order there and sit, or just seat ourselves, or what and she said she'd seat us if we could just wait a minute.  Not feeling the aloha here!!  (I realize this ain't a Hawaiian place, but a little aloha is welcome everywhere.) The food was just ok.  I had the sausage, mushroom, and pepperoni pizza on a thin crust.  Very little sausage and the crust was not impressive - it was thin, I'll give it that.  Lois had the roasted veggie salad but ordered it with ranch dressing.  The salad came with the original vinaigrette dressing and ranch on the side, so she sent it back.  When it came back correct she enjoyed it and thought it was quite good.  Kinda expensive for what it is, though. Overall, the layout and look of the place isn't bad.  It's comfortable and not too loud.  Definitely a family friendly place, I think it's geared toward that.  Considering the average food and the subpar service, though, I don't think I'll be going back any time soon.

Did I tell you yelpers that my salad came with a live bug? That looked like a roach? Freaking tentacles waving at me! I lost it!!!!!!! Oh did I mention I had already started to eat the salad? That the bug was underneath inside my salad!! That it was mixed in with the Ceasars dressing and shrimp? The waiter rushed my plate to the back! The manager was a prick! Not one apology! Just we washed the lettuce is all he said! I could've died! I had no idea which country the bug was from if it had been a lettuce bug deported! All I could think of was me dying from this nasty bug which was living inside my salad that I could have ate it's baby eggs or anything!  And all this jack ass could say is we wash the salad! No apology no nothing! I asked him for his manager number he gave me a bogus one, I asked him to call his manager, he said no! I asked for a copy of this report/incidence and he said he couldn't do it! All lies! Coward. I called their corporate they took my report, supposedly  the manager called me just listened to what I had to say and that was it!  Never heard from them again!!! Screw this dirty nasty place !  And screw the idiots eating in the restaurant saw me in tears about this experience and just looked away. Hope you all had baby eggs and larva in your food.

Don't count on this place for delivery. Wilted Arugula salad, processed dressing, two slices of stale bread for two entrees and no butter anymore. The corporate giants have taken over. Too Bad. It was good at one point. Every time a good corporate executive gets promoted, it's because she or he saved them money--after all, that's how they get promoted...  The threshold for corporations is to SAVE MONEY. So to get an advance, they find a way to cut costs, and unfortunately quality or quantity  too. It's a vicious cycle that all corporations go through until they ultimately fail. Too bad they had to sell out.

Kung Pao spaghetti! Wow! I used to order from CPK at least twice a week. Amazing selection and everything was so flavorful. I moved out of the area now but I try my best to come back to this location. The other locations aren't on the same par!

Friday, 11:30AM. Catching up with an old friend.  Quickie: +Menu options +Receptive service +Clean +Spacious And then...? Wide selection of carbs. Convenient spot in San Mateo. Could be a neutral site for a group with diverse dietary requests. ********** Stuffed my face in: 1. Sausage and mushroom pizza      - Skimped on the sausage      - Mushroom was bland

My company catered lunch from here today. All the vegetarian sandwiches were mixed in with the meat sandwiches, and there was no hint of any vegan sandwiches. And the side salad was wilted and brown. Very disappointing. Going hungry today.
Cons:  Weird obnoxious smell, spoils all dining experience. Toilet super unhygienic, can't describe what I saw Busy and has wait times I am a fan of CPK but this particular place should be avoided!
Went there tonight. Really miss the miso salad and apple crisp. I do like the pasta. The restroom is a little gross.

If they ever take the BBQ Chicken Salad off the menu, I will be a sad, sad woman.  I love that salad. I've eaten it for years, and it's been consistently good all that time. I imagine that many other people feel as I do.  I like the pizzas as well. They seem to keep the same ones on the menu, which is swell by me. I enjoy the five cheese with tomato, the Thai chicken, and the BBQ chicken.  What I'm NOT so in love with, however: prices seem to go up every time I visit. I know these things happen. I also wish they'd get their old bread back -- I think it used to be Boudin. What they have now isn't *bad*, but it used to be *great.* That said, I really like the food, and the service is friendly and usually pretty efficient. Order takeout, sit at the counter, or sit at a table. In fact, I usually do takeout. I'll place my order, shop in some neighboring stores, and come back to get my food. Et voila! Lunch or dinner is (almost) served.
Pizza and pasta is okay, their artichoke dip is amazing! Service is sloppy and although they have many tables, the host is slow to seat ppl..  I liked pasta pomodoro better...

I had a bad experience the last time I was at a CPK in southern California but the smile on the host Amber made me feel welcomed. She was beyond helpful and friendly. Host are important at a restaurant because they are the first person we see when we walked in a restaurant. I am glad Amber was there and I had a wonderful experience. I will diffidently come again but only the days Amber is working. Great job Sweetie!

Good for what it is, a casual family-friendly spot with broad enough selection of good food and drink. The flatbread pizza appetizers were very good (spicy fennel sausage pizza) and the popular fish tacos are good too. The pastas can be hit or miss and sometimes use a lot of oil. Desserts are kind of unnecessary given all the carbs here, but we got them anyway since it was more convenient to stay in one place, and they were fine.

I really like California Pizza Kitchen. Prices are good, salads are delicious, so far we love coming to this place! The only thing I noticed is that in general the men working here give a better service than women. I love this place anyways :)

I'll leave a good review if the repercussions of an issue is taken up with fantastic customer service, but when the solution of an issue becomes worse than the issue itself, that's when shit hits the fan.  We complained about small protein portions in both a taco and salad dish. You're paying $5 extra for salmon in your salad and you get 3 thumb-sized chunks...  So of course, we bring it up with our waiter. He brings the manager over, and the lady sees AND she herself points out "oh that's all they put on your taco..?" And then proceeds to defend why and how the kitchen pre-measures out their protein portions for their dishes. Then asks if we would like more of the salmon and mahi mahi on the dishes.  UMM YA THINK? The fact that you have to still ask to provide us with something we already brought to your attention is a Customer service faux paux. #byefelicia
Not an hour long wait time even when it looks full, good service and the food comes out quick. Thank god for CPK

A good place to eat when out shopping but I wouldn't make a special trip. It's always busy, which isn't a bad thing but as I'm usually alone they try to push me into having lunch at the bar.  I don't like eating at a bar so every time I have to ask for a real table, then they almost always give me this horrid table next to the kitchen.  Seriously, every time.  I understand they are trying to maximize the tables but I feel like I'm being punished for not being a party of 4.  Anyway...the food is always pretty good and consistent.  The pear and gorgonzola pizza is AMAZING.  They did take my favorite dish off the menu...it was fusilli pasta with brocolli and goat cheese.  Oh well...I gave it 3 stars instead of 4 because the servers range from very good to how in the world did this person get a job as a waiter??  There is one guy who is so unhappy working there it is torture to be waited on by him.  I can tell he just wants to be anywhere else but this place and it breaks my heart.  But...sometimes I get very friendly and happy servers so it balances out.  I would recommend the management do more for employee morale.

I've been coming to this CPK for years and I've always had great experiences. The food is standard CPK which is exactly what I come for. This location can get reallllly busy as it is in a pretty big mall. No complaints from me!

This review is for the shady practices at this restaurant. After dining here on a Thursday evening, I received an alert from my credit card that I had given a more than generous tip.  While I had provided just over 20%, the credit card noticed a 30% tip.  The waiter took it upon himself to increase his tip.  With other better options in the area, we will not return to a restaurant that chooses to steal from their customers.
DELISH.. I love the "green" past.. not to mention the Pizza

First time customer. Came for a fundraiser. As agreed upon by guests, their pizza is basically a personal size. The website doesn't offer size or portion information. And more weird... We got a regular pizza which was not more than 1/4 inch thick...so what is a thin pizza? I also got a "bowl" of $7 bean soup and asked about the size-- so a "bowl" is "maybe" 6-8 oz of soup. It was small and is still uneaten on my kitchen island. The $4+ "cup" means they fill that small container half full. Servers were nice but this is a 100% fast food rip off. Never EVER coming here for pizza again!

Good pizza but service is bad so one star instead of the 4 the food would rate. Omg. Terrible phone service. Just trying to order a pizza for pickup and had to talk with 3 different people each more rude than the last. They make you feel like you are supposed to understand what there'll is going on behind their scenes "Oh, well that was the call center - you should call... ". What the f? I called your published phone number. And in the store I see workers on break almost  lying down in the booth with feet in the isle.

I would have given 0 stars but for some weird reason didn't.  1) my pick was at 7.25 pm somehow I am late 10 mins so I arrive at 7.35 they say it will say take more 30 mins to bake salmon. 2) rude service. Completely F****ng annoying. They would give you attitude man. The girl with Dior specs at the take out service is a fail.  3) never go

I love CPK but honestly the service we got really made me uncomfortable & not wanting to go back ... The food is amazing but service is everything.  I went in the afternoon with some of my girlfriends to enjoy some yummy food from here.  The waiter we had was some older guy (in the picture you can see the side of his face).  My friend asked him if the chicken on her salad could be cut into smaller pieces and he said "I'll see if they have time". Wait what ? Are we not paying for this food? Shouldn't it be made how we want it? That is a sentence I never want to hear from a waiter, I'm here paying for my food therefore my food  better be made how I want it. If it's extra $$ just tell me but don't tell me your going to see if they have time.  He was a rude waiter overall and did not seem very happy to be our waiter. The tip we left was very generous because he really just deserved perhaps a $1 for taking our orders.  -unhappy customer (Val)

Ordered caramelized peach salad - the greens are soaked with very SALTY balsamic vinaigrette - I'm not going to have salad here again... Four of us in one table and gave us 4 tiny slices of bread - really? This  restaurant is going downhill - not a fan ...

Been to CPK 3 times in the past month. Always between 2-5Pm, before it gets too crowded.  We have had great service. #1 Want great customer service?  Get Hugo as your waiter or talk to Mark, the manager. #2 Food recommendations. Remember, this is not a traditional Mexican place, it is mostly a pizza place with a twist. We always stick to the small plate appettizers which are a great deal. Definitely recommend the Poblano Flat breads. Cedar plank salmon is a good choice too, but a little overpriced at $19 But a good choice.   The Italian chopped salad is one of of our favorites.  Good portion size on the full. Enough for 3. The kids pizza combos a re a great deal if you have kids under 11. #3 Place is comfortable when not full.  Too bad it is not on the second level with an type of view.  Too bad they usually close the back session and patio weekdays in the afternoon. C'mon, want to eat outside when its sunny! 5 stars is mostly for the service we have received so far and the food. We also love that we get free bread when we order. Also, kudos for honoring a coupon that their corporate sent us via e-mail in error.  They had to, but the attitude they had was cool.  No fuzz!

Surprisingly excellent food and service tonight. It's been awhile since we have been here. The food quality has really improved significantly and our server Teresa was spot on. Will definitely be back again.

We were in town for a show at the Xpo and stopped here to find a place for lunch on a Thursday during a lunch hour. We were promptly seated, water and bread were brought quickly, orders were taken and arrived promptly at the correct temperature and were made correctly. We were checked on regularly but we didn't feel rushed. We were able to pay and get on our way easily. Everything was spot on.

Okay, Okay, I am guilty! This was my first time here on 3/16/15! Yes I said it, FIRST TIMER! I came ONLY because I had a $50 gift certificate and I was SO happy but after I looked at the menu I knew ACTUALLY why my gift card was for so much! Well hello! There prices are a little  HIGH!  I ordered: -Appetizer: Avocado Club Egg Rolls! ~5\5 Very yummy and I loved the dipping sauce that comes with it!  Salad-: Asian Chicken Salad ~10\5 haha really they exceeded my expectations! I truly couldn't get enough of this and wanted to ask for another order! It was SO delicious and definitely a MUST try! I was sad to see the pricing of it but hey its worth it. No doubt! Meal: I ordered their Hawaiian Hand tossed pizzas which was totally enough for me and another person to share.( Please note, this place doesn't have thick crust). Hours of operation: ~Mon - Thurs 11:00 AM-09:00 PM ~Fri - Sat 11:00 AM-10:00 PM ~Sun 11:00 AM-08:00 PM Just a note: this place does get packed and busy during Friday through Sunday! Every available service per location is different but this particular location provides: ~Catering ~ Complimentary Parking ~Curbside Service ~ Delivery (M-F, until 2pm, 5 mile radius, $100 min) ~Full Bar ~ Hosts FUNdraisers ~Kids Menu ~Online Ordering ~ Patio Seating ~Takeout Menu ~Valet Parking I would definitely be back here again! I have SO many other things I would like to try on their menu!

I come here for lunch because it is close to my work. I usually place my order over the phone so that it is ready when I get there. It's usually never ready at the time quoted by the person on the phone. It's also dirty in the restaurant and the servers do not seem happy to be at work. The food is decent but nothing that speaks volume. There is one take out server that is always pleasant though. I wish I could remember his name because he always remembers mine. It's a nice touch.

I had a gift card, so I came to CPK.  Worst restaurant ever. Before ordering the tostada pizza, we asked if the pizza (especially because of the ranch sauce) is vegetarian and does not contain eggs. Waitress confirmed that it is a vegetarian pizza. We asked again just to be sure and were reassured. Later we found out that the pizza not only had eggs but also had anchovies! I wrote to the corporate office. I got a standard email saying someone will follow up. And that was that - it's been weeks! I can understand that mistakes are made sometimes. But it is a different story when the restaurant does not care at all about quality or service. Also, in this case, it is really worst - what if I had some food allergies?! Service is not that great, and food is just whatever for the high price you are paying. The pizza barely had any topping other than lettuce, and it was also cold. I would rather take my business to some local restaurant.

Food was great as always. Service was just ok this time. Although very pleasant, our server (or anyone for that matter) didn't check up on us after the food was served. All of us had some type of pasta and we were trying to get anyone's attention for a.side of parmisean cheese. No biggie, but would have been nice to have while the pasta was hot....

Strangely enough, we come here specifically for their Jambalaya pasta dish. Their pizzas are good too if you like their thin crust style which I do. Being a chain restaurant you have to set your expectations accordingly. The service can be hit or miss but lately has been fairly consistent. Pizza here is a step above fast food pizza like papa johns but not quite the same as more authentic pizza places with coal or wood fire ovens or artisan pizzerias. The ingredient combinations available are good and will satisfy any pizza craving.
First time at this restaurant, I ordered roast veggie with grill shrimp, it is delicious!!!! Would definitely order again next time. Remember half side order is good enough for one person.

I simply love this place- awesome ambience, niche staff, great food and super dessert. I like their pizzas, avocado egg roll and desserts are to die for... There have been times when I just went in to have flatbreads and dessert.
Whenever I go here I always get FOOD POISONING! I will never recommend this place to anyone I will not be coming here again ever.

My family went to this restaurant to celebrate my nephew's birthday instead of Cheesecake Factory because the wait was 2 hours. I don't eat at CPK very often. I don't even really know where it is located in SF. It's good for a fun family dinner. It's not expensive. It's nicer than Pizza Hut or any pizza joint. it's a sit down restaurant with an American ambience. I shared the Moroccan salad and Kung Pao spaghetti with my mom and dad. There's nice bread with olive oil to start. I also got a lemonade(free refills) and a key lime pie slice that was generous. Their lemonade recipe wasn't the best I've had. I think it's fun every once in a while, and I'd come back to CPK.

Service sometimes tends to be hit or miss especially if it gets busy. The complimentary bread doesn't always make it to the table and if does, is usually late.  The food though tends to be great which is why the overall 4 star. The Thai peanut salad with avocado instead of chicken rocks every time. The strawberry mango cooler was too sweet but likely because I asked for lite ice (they should have ideally added a little bit more water instead). The arugula asparagus salad is good as well as the sweet corn and chips appetizer.

CPK is a good middle of the road option. It is not great and it is not bad either. This particular location has an appeal because it is close to the food court at the Hillsdale mall and a better option that anything you can find there.

Surprisingly, this place was packed around 1pm on a Sunday afternoon, though we didn't wait at all for a table. I don't remember being enchanted with CPK on my one or two visits to the chain, but I very much enjoyed the food we had this meal: we shared a The Works pizza, which includes sausage, pepperoni, olives, onions, and peppers and a full size roasted veggie salad. They ask if you want complimentary bread, which of course I accepted. The oil and herb mixture they offer for dipping is very savory, fragrant, and tasty. I have actually found myself thinking about it since my meal here and contemplating how to recreate it at home. I liked the saltiness of the meats on the pizza. Most of all, I liked how the pizza wasn't overladen with cheese and the thin, crispiness of the crust. It's fun and all to see strings of cheese dripping of pizza, but to eat it that way actually grosses me out. CPK has a lighter, more appetizing take on pizza. The roasted veggie salad consisted of a spring mix with avocado, asparagus, artichoke, and other yummy greens. I might ask for a bit lighter hand with the balsamic dressing next time, but the salad was overall tasty and with added protein would definitely satisfy as a meal by itself.  The total plus tax and tip was $35 for three of us, which is a reasonable price. This lunch boosted my opinion of CPK! Now, I will think of it as a good place for an affordable sit-down meal with high quality food.

Yesterday was my first time at California Pizza Kitchen. All I have to say is WOW. Everything was great. I am a picky eater and I have to say that the food was excellent. Not only was the food very good, the customer service provided at CPK was very welcoming and it was very much appreciated.  We went in around 715 and we were told the wait was about 10-15 so of course we decided to wait. My friend wanted to look at the menu so when he asked the hostess, she was rude. She just handed him the menu without even looking at him with a smile or anything. This left a horrible impression and I was already dissatisfied. I used to work in a restaurant so I know how important first impressions are and hers was not great. I would recommend getting rid of her because she gave a bad vibe upon 10 mins being there especially that we were first timers. I will not go on about her because the rest of the staff was truly great. We were seated after 10 mins like we were told. The name of the server we had was Gianna. She was amazing. She was very helpful with her suggestions and she really made us feel welcomed. You could tell that she likes her job and she was not bothered no matter how many questions we asked. I loved her customer service and I hope we get her again. The hostess should take a couple tips from Gianna.  We were told if we sign up for the rewards, we would receive a free small plate. We got the Shaved Mushroom and Spinach flat bread. It was DELICIOUS. The name of the manager that was working was Becky.  She was super nice and friendly. You could tell that she was loved her job as well. She brought us the flat bread which was surprising because managers usually sit there and dont send food. She was very active and we really felt welcomed by her. Its nice to see that even though she is a manager, She still cared to help the servers. We were also served bread and it was soo yummy. The oil with spices was just amazing.  For the Entree we ordered the California Cobb Salad and Half Tostada pizza and half California Club. It was amazing. There are no words to describe how good the pizza was. Throughout our entire dinner, Gianna was checking on us and getting a refill and just all around great.  Towards the end of the meal, We were so full we did not want to get up and walk. Becky the manager came up and checked on us again. It was so sweet that a manager showed how much she cared about our first time here. She offered us a free dessert but we declined since we were so full. It was really sweet of her and we appreciate the amazing customer service. Both Becky and Gianna really made our first time here amazing and totally made us forget about the rude hostess. We will be back very soon and I will make sure to bring in my family and friends that have never been here before.

At the mall on a Friday night, the stores are closing and my friend and I find that we're starving. We decide to go to CPK. Turns out EVERYONE had the same idea. CPK is packed with families and there are a dozen more waiting. There are two of us so we could have sat at the bar but it basically looked like sitting in the kitchen, so we waited. And waited. And waited. We finally got probably the worst two-top in the place, right next to the seats we'd rejected. Ha! Next to one of the waiter stations. We cajoled our way into a better seat but were clearly hated for asking. No matter. We were in a nice booth and could rest after a long shopping spree. I ordered a glass of wine and they ask if you want small or large. HUH? Regular glass of wine, which one is regular? 6 oz or 9 oz is the answer. Good lord. My friend ordered a Corona and I kid you not, the waiter brought a 24 oz giant bottle! She said "oh, I had no idea it was a giant bottle." We're totally mystified as the waiter knows that it's just the two of us girls. "I can't drink all this, I wish you would have said something," she says. To which the waiter shrugs and says something about thinking we wanted to party. UGH. I've eaten at lots of CPKs and -- for a chain restaurant -- it's quite good. Crispy crust, regular pizzas, the signature dishes, big salads, I love it all. But this particular one needs to be cleaned and/or remodeled. It has that gross dirty carpet smell that puts me right back in college to my days waiting tables. It's the way a lot of places smell before they start cooking the food. But when you're sitting right next to the kitchen in full swing, and it smells like dirty carpet, it makes you wonder just how filthy it is. Kind of ruins the experience.

Ok so I used to work here and clearly the customer satisfaction and derive has gone down. The last two time I came here my servers were very slow and rude. After a very exhausted day at work I would like to get some good food and enjoy and nice time with my husband . So I came in today and we ordered soup, tricolori pizza and chicken piccata . As we wait for a long time for our food the host was very nice enough to ask is if someone has take our order. Right after she asked all of our food is brought to the table. Firstly that is. It ok because by the time we finish the soup the rest of the food will be cold !  Even though I did not specify with the server Igor should have asked us if we wanted all out items at separate times. I had to speak to a manager and send the food back . This really pisses me off and I will most likely not come here ever ! I was not going to leave a tip but my husband have him $3.

Great place, great food, favorite BBQ Pizza with Bacon. The service was great cause we did not ask too many god damn thing that's not in the menu. Note: To foodies, this not a fancy gourmet restaurant or whatever turd imagination you have. Order what's on the damn menu.  Don't drag the service with your stupid request. Others customers needs to eat to so show respect and you shall get respect in return. Keep in mind, some employees work a living, support their families and some goes to school after so don't be a pain ND ass.

Personally had good service during their lunch on this Saturday. We came close to 2pm, there was a line out the door but everyone was seated promptly. We waited less than 5 minutes and seated along the wall across from the expediting area. All the orders seem to be cracking out of the kitchen, only thing is, there's no heat lamp so if your food is sitting there a while, it will get cold. For us, our food was fast, hot, and delicious. I tried the salad pizza and it was amazing and filled you up. Our server was really good, asked us to join the rewards program and offered all other possible food recommendations. We had iced teas and he was super fast with identifying when our drinks were getting low and asking us for a refill. In/out before 3pm. I can see how this place can be a hit or miss but the last few times I've been here it has been good. I must come when it's slow because it can easily get chaotic with its small space.

One of my fave at CPK!  I had the Cedar Plank Salmon - Roasted on a cedar plank on a hearth oven with smoked paprika and lime. Served with white corn & spinach succotash topped with Feta. It was fantastic!  Our waiter was excellent.. simple as that!  Will definitely come again. (Late post: 7/19/15)

For my daughters 14th Birthday she wanted to go to California Pizza Kitchen... The food was amazing, our service was just as awesome! Tanner store manager went beyond the call of duty!!! I would like to thank him and say I wish you worked at my store!! No to ho coffee cut so he made one for me!! Thank was so cool.... Thank you Tanner!!! Thank you California Pizza Kitchen.. My daughter had a great Birthday....xo

The "Caramelized Peach Salad" with added bacon is amazing. Its light and refreshing with their housemade white balsamic vinaigrette yet filling when you add the bacon. This is a salad that I will crave for because its that good.
Slow service but good server. Aren't we supposed to get warm bread. Didn't get it.  Flatbread was warm not hot.
Waldorf salad and Cobb salad are my favorites here. All the food is yummy.  If they offer organic options and pastured grass fed meats options I will raise my rating to 5 stars.
I arrived at curbside pick-up and called at 7:03pm. It's now 7:24pm and I'm still waiting. I'll call again after this review. Last time ever.

I ordered two salads, I know this place is over priced but my husband likes it. I order a small Caesar salad. I Get Home and my salad it's half way full, lots of core Romaine and rusted lettuce!  I think CPK just lost my business.

What I've learned from tonight's dinner -- CPK has jacked their prices and lowered the quality of their food, but after 4 days spent with a gluten-free vegan tetotaler, a glass of wine and half a pizza goes down nicely, especially when the cute bartender keeps flirting to get a bigger tip.

Poor guest services. We called ahead and were told it would be a 20 minute wait. We're asked to wait another 20 minutes after we checked in. Told them we'd be waiting at the bar. An hour passes and no apologies, no table. Freddy, who claims to be the manager, completely blew it.

My boyfriend and I get CPK whenever we're not too sure what to eat. I'm normally not a huge fan of pizza, but actually enjoy CPK's pizzas. I've only ever ordered the pizzas so I can't really review their pastas/salads/whatever else they serve. We usually get a California Club pizza, though we've tried a few other ones like the teriyaki, the mushroom and sausage, and some of the seasonal ones (one had artichoke, egg, and potatoes!). The California Club is by far my favorite -- it feels like a healthier version of pizza. They're generous with the veggies that they top it with.  One pizza's ~$15 and we usually share. Between the pizza and the free bread they serve at the beginning, it's sufficiently filling for dinner.  They can get really, really busy around lunch time. A lot of families will stop in before or after a day of shopping, so it gets especially crowded on the weekends. I'd give them 5/5 but service is really hit or miss, sometimes they're really on top of everything and other times (especially when it's really busy) it can get difficult to flag down someone to refill your water or close your check.

An alright place. The pizza are nothing too special, but are decent and better than other places. For a chain pizza place, its not too bad. I would recommend for lunch at the mall after shopping. But overall, don't expect anything really great.

The Hillsdale CPK is awesome. We live closer to the Stanford location, and refuse to go there anymore because it's always a horrible experience. This location is delightful. They are always attentive, the food tastes great, and they go above and beyond.

When my husband and I had late lunch, We ordered, original bbq chicken pizza and it was delicious. The table where we sat, smelled horrible because it wasn't clean properly. it smelled like dirty rag.

CPK is never going to be a destination for me. I'm an avowed NY pizza snob and this isn't a place for particularly good pizza. Having said that, the food is reasonable and the service we had for our daughter's birthday party was pretty terrific. Thanks Jazmine!
Trust me, they're three stars. Don't expect more, or less. Most of the time their pizzas are good, but the experience is usually lacking. Still better than Papa Johns.
First time here at this CPK. Dirty Plates, dirty spoons....service was okay cause it wasn't that busy...this do got more lighting than Pleasanton one.

One of the worst experiences at a restaurant. The server MANNY in particular was very rude. When I first walked in the booth I wiped the seat with a napkin and he said "well is it clean enough for you." I will not be coming back. Carlos was very polite though.

I went to the mall with my wife and daughter and after shopping we stopped by cpk for lunch. When we were served there was no silverware to be found. We had to ask what looked like the manager because our waitress could not be found. Then we noticed there was no dressing for the quinoa salad and we asked another waiter because ours again was missing . Our drinks ran dry and with the waitress missing I couldnt wait to pay the bill. Kelly the waitress was very nice when she was around, but I saw no urgency at all.  We were neglected and the manager was talking and laughing to other employees in the kitchen. This visit was my last for the Hillsdale location.
Food wasn't as tasty as other cpk's, the seats smelled really bad, and the carpet as well! Will I come back to this place? Absolutely not!

If you are planning to have a birthday party here good luck trying, the manager will never call you back. I have emailed and called numerous times and left my information with people who told me I would be getting a call back the next day and it never happens. I guess they don't want you business and want you to go elsewhere for parties.

Not quite sure what some ppl (other reviewers) expect from a glorified Pizzeria like CPK? Personally, as an adult, I would not eat there, because it is too expensive and wanna-be everything, really. I'd rather spend maybe a bit more and then have actual Italian food, and with all the associated goodies - Tartufo, Espresso, and so on (they do NOT have that!!!) The reason why I still end up going there regularly is because my kids like it, and they are fine with the choices offered. Also, should you know that you will go, do not forget to get the Costco coupons - $80 for $100 value - together with the 5% every $100from signing up and checking in through their app, it makes it a good value.

The pizza selection is unique.  However I do favor the Thai Chicken and Jamaican Jerk chicken.  Try the hummus appetizer.  It's small but hits the spot.  The environment and staff is nice.  Enjoy the game on the tv or good laughs with the family.  Once your done enjoy some window shopping in the mall.  I hear there is a bowling alley and theatre coming soon to the old Sears space.  I say check it out.
I fell sick after eating at this place. Anything worse they can do for their own reputation ?  Please avoid if you can.
This is probably the worst service restaurant in San Mateo. Would avoid at all cost. Servers are rude and do not place customers first.

Keep giving this place a chance. Used to love it but price keeps going up and not returning in quality or quantity. Just paid $49.00 for an Oriental chicken, Bbq chicken salad, and a bbq chicken pizza. Both salads didn't even fill half of their boxes.
Seriously cost cutting.   Lettuce wraps is now half the size.   Last time coming to this location.

The menu is the same as in all CPK's but the service is what can make a difference. After several tries ( actually since 2009) I have decided to drive to Palo Alto despite the fact that I can walk to this location. My last experience with curbside pick up was the top, I waited and waited and saw everyone that arrive after me leave while the restaurant made no effort to communicate with me. My order was VERY Simple. One Pizza and several small plates. I complained and the GM ( Fausto Cedillo) apologized. Unfortunately, I can not sponsor this location as is inconsistent and unpredictable in service.

We went here today and they told us our wait time for a party of 4 would be about 15 minutes they took us in about 5 minutes. Our server was Ray. He was very attentive. My head was turned watching the Giants game that was on tv and a manager seen me turned around and came up to ask me if I needed something. They were very helpful and catering to my family!! Good food too!!

First time here and we had pretty bad service. No bread and our server forgot plates. Pizza was alright but there are many other better pizza places for the same price. It's convenient if you have kids because of the mall location but otherwise, we probably won't come again.

We arrived at 1:40pm on a Saturday and asked for a table for 8(2 kids, 6 adults). We knew/expected there to be a wait and sure enough hostess said 30 min wait. We put our name down and walked over to the bird show that was by the escalators. At 1:59pm we were back at the front door to ask for a status update. Hostess said "we called you at 2pm and you weren't here". I check my phone and it read 1:59pm. She turned to check the clipboard and said "oh we called you at 1:57pm". I then asked "does that mean our table was given away?"  She radio someone and confirmed they sat someone else at a table for 8. "We don't hold tables, sorry. It will be another 20 mins for your table". I said thanks but no thanks. We lost our table in 2 mins (120 seconds). No yelling no talking to manager. We left and went over to Cheesecake Factory and got seated in 5 mins.

Stopped in for a little lunch with one of my co-workers. We both love this place and we love to come and eat at the bar. I had a mushroom pizza and it was very good, but my favorite pizza here is veg pizza. My co-worker had the Hawaiian Pizza, which thankfully had enough pineapple for each bite he had. These pizzas are always perfect and yum. The best part is that if you get something you don't like they replace it without a hassle because of their "Menu Adventure Guarantee" The staff was outstanding. Great service coupled with great food. One word: Extraordinary!

I was so excited for my long awaited Italian chopped salad. There were hardly any customers and I waited patiently for my take out. I ordered a full Italian chop and paid over 16 dollars for it. I arrived home and started eating it just to notice that they completely scrimped on the dressing. I'm not sure if they forgot it : as there was no container of dressing) but I'm so disappointed that I am eating leaves instead of a salad

Service was bad from the hostess to the waiter... Very disappointed at this location.  Wrong drink given to my honey the food was served w/o utensils and the waiter didn't even check on us if I needed a refill...
I've had better pizza at other CPK locations. Cocktails could've been better. Service was mediocre.

My family and I visited yesterday while out that way, my daughters played it safe and stuck with the pepperoni pizza...can't go wrong with that.  We'd never dined here and while reading the menu found that this was more than just a pizza joint.  Thinking about me, my husband chose the CALIFORNIA CLUB Pizza...what a great choice, this was basically a pizza with salad on top...when it arrived at the table, We all looked at it, then at each other in disappointment.  At this point me and our 2 daughters reached for a slice of pepperoni.  My husband being the trooper that he is, tasted a slice of the cal club pizza, acknowledging  it was good, I tried a slice...OMG!!!!!!!it was different but some of the best I'd ever tasted.  The combination of ingredients complimented each other perfectly. bacon, roasted chicken and Mozzarella, baked then topped with avocado, wild arugula, fresh basil and Romaine tossed in lemon-pepper mayo. 2 pizza's, fried mac n cheese(), dumpling(a must have) and drinks...less than $50.  We enjoyed the food so much we barely noticed the customer service, which by the way was great as well.

Food is very good. Very busy place but the service is quite efficient and staff are friendly. Pizza is good and Dessert is excellent. One draw back is the distinctive smell similar to Cheesecake Factory.

Food is good ,customer service is good  the margaritas are always  good but the place smells they really need to clean more properly every time we sit on the back its really hard to enjoy our dinner the  furniture is messed up the carpet smells  hopefully they remodel the back soon

My first choice was the food court but since I figured they are remodeling, my friend and I decided to head to the nearest place and it was California pizza kitchen. We both ordered the same thing. Garlic chicken fettuccini. The taste was pretty decent. Although the for the price, the portion could be bigger. Compared to Cheesecake Factory close by, for the price you pay at pizza kitchen, you'll get a much bigger portion at cheesecake and enjoy your food more.  Our server was really sweet so it came with a very well deserved tip. I'm all about great customer service even if the food isn't all that.

I tried to eat at this location once. I was seated at the bar. The bartender was putting away glasses at the other end and paused to serve a new drink to the patron down there. Around 5 minutes later, two women came in and were also seated at the bar. The bartender immediately came over and served - even doted on them. Preparing their drinks immediately and following up with their food order - then he went back to the glassware, completely ignoring me after serving patrons who came in at least 10 minutes after me. I mentioned it to the hostess and she just acted clueless - not even apologetic. We've gotten food from this location via my employer and door dash - ingredients are regularly missing from dishes (no crawfish in the Jambalaya for example) or allergy requests are ignored (which could be a problem with door dash, not CPK). Either way, the food is mediocre and overpriced for what amounts to standard chain fare done semi-poorly and the service at this location was abysmal in my attempted experience.

Our family had dinner at California Pizza Kitchen last night. The service we received from Monique was outstanding! She was very attentive and brought our 6 pizzas in exactly the order we requested them. She regularly checked in on us, and did so with a cheerful and pleasant manner. Our meal was delicious and the service was outstanding!
This restaurant has been a longtime favorite of mine . I love the bbq chicken salad and thier yummy soups . Service is very friendly .
Just decent. Had the option of salad and pizza - wasn't impressed but wasn't bad. Took awhile to get service and sat at bar- waiter was nice though. Food was ok but I could live without it.

I have coming to this restaurant for several years and to my surprise the service has become worse the past several visits. They appear to be busy to properly serve the customer and the take out is completely useless!  Once instance they stated they never received the order from the call center according to the girl behind the counter and placed the blame to them...I don't care who screwed up! Fix the problem and get my order in so I can eat my meal is what I conveyed. Will now only eat there at the very last resort, I find the Stanford location's service is much better and friendlier.

Very disappointed with the service today at CPK,San Mateo, I goto CPK quite often and today was my worst experience ever. When I asked for extra plates I was given dirty ones and was told if I wanted extra plates this was it or I should use the small appetizer ones. This is not what I expect from CPK. This location has definitely gone down in service and food quality. The only folks who helped me out were the two greeters at the front door who went above and beyond their job role!

This review is strictly for takeout only.  I used to love getting takeout from CPK.  Recently, they changed their to go boxes.  I ordered the Artichoke Spinach Dip and small Chinese Chicken Salad.  I got home and the size of the dip had been reduced to a "good soup spoon in a half".  Pricing didn't change but portion had gotten much smaller.  Called to talk to the Manager (Mark).  First, he defended the kitchen saying that they measure all the portions/orders.  Secondly, he made me (the customer) feel like I was in the wrong.  Then reluctantly offered to credit me for the item (which never happened) and lastly, suggested that maybe I should check the order before leaving the restaurant or maybe not order it anymore.  Nice customer service.  I will be taking my business to Paul Martin's now, thank you Mark!
The Hillsdale Mall CPK has a really strange mouldy smell. Best to avoid and go to Cheesecake Factory

This review is for the take-out and curb side service.  This location has the worst service for curb side. They take 15-30 minutes longer to get your order. The staff doesn't seem to care. They never apologize or acknowledge the long wait. Do not order here unless you ha e plenty of time to spare.

Well I always give a second opportunity to everyone but this place and the service didn't change since my last dinner on this restaurant. What I don't really understand why the cashier name Katherine still working there, this lady have a really but actitud and I told her manager once if she is not happy with this kind work please find something else and let another person take this position, hopefully some day this restaurant change.

Such a disappointing experience.  Our hostess was kind a friendly.  But when our waiter arrived, he was haughty and seemed like he was in a hurry.
